TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class TypeBrowserDialog : System.Windows.Forms.Form, IServiceProvider, System.ComponentModel.ISite
.class public auto ansi sealed TypeBrowserDialog extends System.Windows.Forms.Form implements class System.ComponentModel.ISite, class System.IServiceProvider

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Represents a dialog box that allows the user to choose a type. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
This class prompts the user to browse a list of Windows Workflow Foundation and .NET Framework namespaces and their contained types and select a single type.

Docs.summary: Gets the type selected by the user in the type browser dialog box.
Docs.value: The <xref:System.Type> selected by the user in the type browser dialog box.

Docs.summary: Gets the component to associate with the type browser dialog box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the property returns a valid value--anything other than a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic)--the component is added to <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog>.
This property is required because <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog> implements <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite>. For <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System.ComponentModel.ISite.Component%2A> always returns a null reference (`Nothing`).

Docs.summary: Gets the container to associate with the type browser dialog.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System.ComponentModel.ISite.Container%2A> returns a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System.ComponentModel.ISite.Component%2A> has not bound an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog>.
This method is required because <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog> implements <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite>. For <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System.ComponentModel.ISite.Container%2A> always returns a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the type browser dialog is in design mode.
Docs.value: if is in design mode; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is required because <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog> implements <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite>. For <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System.ComponentModel.ISite.DesignMode%2A> always returns `true`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets name of the component associated with the type browser dialog.
Docs.value: The name of the component associated with the type browser dialog.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is required because <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog> implements <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance object System.IServiceProvider.GetService(class System.Type serviceType) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Type> of service object to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the service object for the specified type.
Docs.returns: A service object of type , or a null reference ( in Visual Basic) if there is no service object of type .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `serviceType` is of type <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ITypeProvider>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System.IServiceProvider.GetService%2A> returns a service object. Otherwise, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System.IServiceProvider.GetService%2A> returns a null reference (`Nothing`).
